bibl.title: Letter from M.A. Rhoads to Philip Showalter Hench, February 16, 1948

div1.p: Rhoads advises Hench that the Old German House and the present Athenaeum are one and the same. The Old German House, as such, has not been replaced.

div1.head: Letter from M.A. Rhoads to Philip Showalter Hench, February 16, 1948
div1.opener:
k
KEELING & Co., INCORPORATED
CHAMBER OF COMMERCE BUILDING · ADVERTISING
__________________________________________________
INDIANAPOLIS 4
February 16, 1948
Dr. Philip S. Hench
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minnesota
Dear Dr. Hench:
div1.p:
With regard to your letter of February 10, Mr.
Keeling has asked me to advise you that the old German
House and the present Athenaeum are one and the same
thing.

The old German House, as such, has not been
replaced.
div1.closer:
Sincerely yours, M.A. Rhoads
Secretary to Mr. Keeling
KEELING & CO., Incorporated MAR X
MEMBER AMERICAN ASSOCIATION OF ADVERTISING AGENCIES
